attributes.action: Standardise the upper age limit to 18yrs for treatment at a Children’s Hospital.
attributes.background: Isabel Gentry died from Meningitis B on 20/5/16 aged 16yrs. The inquest in to her death found that she had received substandard medical care. One issue was  Isabel’s age as it was unclear whether she should go to the Children’s or Adult A & E. Hospital guide lines state 16+years are Adult.
attributes.additional_details: An independent medical expert stated that if Isabel had attended at her hospital in London she would still be alive today. The hospital there accepts children up to the age of 18 years. A teenager’s physiology is different than that of an adult and therefore requires a different level of treatment. The upper age limit for treatment at a Childrens Hospital should be standardised at 18 years.

attributes.action: Reverse the mortgage interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords.
attributes.background:
The government will curb the amount of tax landlords can claim back on their property investments, meaning buying and renting out property may no longer be viable for many.
This will result in some landlords who finance their business with mortgages paying tax despite making no profit.
attributes.additional_details:
The policy discriminates against individual buy-to-let investors by denying them the same rights as other business owners.'
In no other business are costs wholly incurred to fund the business liable for taxation.

attributes.action: UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland
attributes.background:
PM Theresa May will be entering into Brexit negotiations with Nicola Sturgeon hanging around her leg like an anchor.
The time has come for the UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland.
attributes.additional_details:
The overwhelming success of the SNP in the 2015 General election.
The ratio of Scottish votes to remain in the EU
The volume of hate and vitriol from our neighbours  in the north
William Wallace
The battle of Bannockburn https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Bannockburn

attributes.action: Stop the Boundary Commission splitting Great Grimsby into two constituencies
attributes.background: Parliamentary boundaries define the area where a person votes for their local MP – their parliamentary constituency. A boundary review examines these areas and makes proposals for a new set of boundaries which are fairer and more equal, while also trying to reflect GEOGRAPHIC FACTORS and LOCAL TIES.
attributes.additional_details: The Boundary Commission’s proposal to cut our historic town completely down the middle therefore makes no sense, separating the famed docks in East Marsh Ward from the centrepiece People’s Park in Park Ward and the River Freshney in Freshney Ward from the ancient village in Scartho Ward. The proposal is unfair, undemocratic and unacceptable and is based on an out-of-date version of the electoral register. Sign this petition and keep the town of Great Grimsby in one seat.

attributes.action: Reverse Philip Hammond's decision to abolish Class 2 NICs
attributes.background: Philip Hammond proposes to abolish Class 2 National Insurance Credits, a move which targets the lowest self-employed earners - many of whom make only a few thousand pounds a year - and will force them to increase NIC payments by 400-500% in order to preserve their State Pension. This is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: These measures unfairly target self employed people under the small earnings threshold who make less than £6,000 a year. People who are forced to work part-time due to caring responsibilities, children, old age or disability, or in low paying sectors such as the arts, will need to find an extra £600 a year, or else lose entitlement to their state pension. These workers have no access to employer subsidised work pensions and any provision for retirement they make already costs twice as much.

attributes.action: Demand easy re-registration of British-registered vehicles in other EU countries
attributes.background: British citizens re-registering their vehicles abroad (in the EU) are experienced serious and costly administrative obstruction, or being refused. Vehicles presented in EU states with accompanying V5C that states the vehicle's EC Type Approval Number should be allowed easy and low-cost registration.
attributes.additional_details:
A core principle of the EU is freedom of movement of citizens and labour. Migrating citizens' vehicles should be easy to re-register in EU states if the registrant presents an EC Type Approval Number as printed on the UK V5C. This number proves EU-wide road conformity for the vehicle.

This is supported by  EC directive 2007/C68/04 which states that a vehicle already registered in a member state should not be tested again on the same criteria at re-registration or have to undergo further tests.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of vehicle/ van lock picks in the UK
attributes.background: In a new scandal, hundreds of vans are having their security systems bypassed by lock picks used by thieves. All doors are unlocked and the alarm turned off, so that thieves can relieve tradesmen of their hard earned tools, taking away their livelihood and taking food off tables.

attributes.action: Licence the Automotive Repair Sector
attributes.background: With vehicle technology advancing at such a pace repairs to vehicles need to be done at the highest standards and following manufactures guidelines. The scope of repairs is needed to be done by a qualified technician.
attributes.additional_details: Modern vehicles are almost impossible to repair without training and specialist tooling either electrical or mechanical. Making it mandatory to have a licence would enable technicians have sufficient training to ensure vehicles are repaired correctly to workshop repair guides.

attributes.action: Establish legal presumption of shared, 50:50, care after parents' break up
attributes.background:
The adversarial character of family legal system is not fit for purpose.
The bias of legal professionals ( lawers, social workers, caffcass officers, family centres staff, judges) is causing more harm then good . Simple initial presumption of 50 :50 child care split will give power back to parents
attributes.additional_details:
In Sweden approximately40% of separated parents share care 50:50 and it is higher amongst younger children.
In the majority of cases the minimum of shared parenting is 30%
Just 2% of disputes are resolved in court

attributes.action: Government introduce & underwrite affordability mortgages for first time buyers
attributes.background: It's unfair that young people have to pay such extortionate rents & may never own their own homes.  They are paying incredibly high rents with no security and this has to be re-balanced.  If they have been proven to pay rent &  have good credit history they should be able to own their own home

attributes.action: Stop prescribing medicines such as Paracetamol on the NHS!
attributes.background: The NHS spent £87.6 million pounds last year on paracetamol tablets which can be bought 20 times cheaper in a supermarket. Doctors wrote 22.9 million prescriptions at an average cost of £3.83. These painkillers can be bought in supermarkets for as little as 19p!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Let us all do out bit and let us help the NHS put its funding to better use. Lets stop prescribing medicines for common colds which can be bought so cheaply and freely in any supermarket or corner shop!

attributes.action: Mandatory First Aid training and certificate to all students 15-18 years old
attributes.background: Mandatory First Aid training is excellent as no one ever knows if or when a medical situation will arise, therefore these skills will be necessary in order to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 140,000 people every year die in situations where their lives could have been saved if somebody had known first aid according to a article from the Guardian. 
Around 2 million people are in secondary education, therefore providing mandatory first aid to would decrease the numbers of people dying due to preventative deaths significantly.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Start education programmes in schools to highlight the recurrence of sexism
attributes.background: Sexism is an everyday problem that should be a concern to all of us. Even if we think that it is gradually improving as time moves on, it isn't. Catcalling and gender stereotyping and targeting is a huge issue, and much of the younger generation seems to find it acceptable because of many influences
attributes.additional_details: By introducing an education programme in secondary schools, we can teach everyone, no matter what gender, about everyday sexism, how it affects people and how it can be prevented. This will lead us one step closer to getting rid of sexism once and for all.

attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.

attributes.action: Investigations offered for all miscarried babies regardless of gestation.
attributes.background: Miscarrying a much loved and wanted child is heart breaking.  It is a life changing event that leaves the parents, especially the mother, with many unanswered questions.  Often guilt is felt and not knowing WHY is very damaging both psychologically and emotionally.  Testing will bring understanding
attributes.additional_details: Testing is not routinely offered unless a lady has had 3 or more miscarriages, or her loss happens in the second or third trimester.  As miscarriages happen in 1:4 pregnancies this leaves a very high percentage of women with questions and unimaginable pain.  The not knowing WHY is often the hardest to come to terms with.  Many miscarriages do have an underlying reason and for the parents who have lost their baby this is vital information that would help them.  They have the right to know WHY.

attributes.action: GOVT Ban all existing & proposed PSPOs affecting quality of life of dog owners
attributes.background: Borough councils are waging Total War against dog owners by abusing the Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO). PSPOs are grossly abused by councils to impose wide restrictions against and affect the quality of life of a SINGLE demographic. HMGovt ban all orders preventing off lead exercising of dogs
attributes.additional_details: PSPOs are intended to prevent Criminal & Anti-Social behaviour, e.g. a PSPO can be used to gate a community to prevent persistent anti-social offences like burglary, violence, drinking & drugs. PSPOs are not intended to penalise, criminalise and demonise dog owners wishing to provide humane exercise to their dogs. Councils even raise PSPOs against Town and Village Greens (‘TVGs’) & Public Rights of Way affecting the quality of life for millions of people. HMG ban all such orders immediately

attributes.action: Fireworks - ONLY SOLD to the public with licence from Local Council @ £50.
attributes.background:
Sale of FIREWORKS - The way forward
a)  To purchase FIREWORKS public need to obtain a licence from their Local Council.  Licence should be at least £50, dates avail on a website.
b)  People need to use Facebook/media as a Communication tool to let others know about forthcoming firework displays.

attributes.action: Make female hygiene dispensers compulsory in all secondary schools.
attributes.background: It is not realistic to expect all individuals to be prepared for an instance where they may need sanitary products, especially in adolescence. Products should be on offer in the case of an individual finding themselves unprepared, to avoid any stress or embarrassment.

attributes.action: Allow Retail Promotions of First Formula Milk once the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: EU law prohibits retailers from discounting new baby formula milk and from offering coupons or points with loyalty schemes. Whilst we know 'Breast is Best', what if a woman can't breastfeed or chooses not to? We should be able to choose how to feed our babies without justification or judgement.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum standard of contraceptive availability across the UK
attributes.background: The Independent and BBC report that funding cuts have caused some GPs to stop providing the contraceptive coil, IUD and contraceptive implant. It makes no sense to reduce access to cost-effective, proven modern contraceptive innovations; local authorities must receive adequate funds to provide this.
attributes.additional_details: Access to a full range of contraception prevents pregnancy (abortions and raising unplanned children are both more costly) and is vital for managing many health problems (thyroid malfunction, severe migraine/period pain, endometriosis). Government must a) require ring-fenced, guaranteed contraceptive funding (and reinstate provisions where cut) b) enforce minimum provisions: amount of options discussed with patients and available within a certain distance, and availability of long-acting methods

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to deal with animal welfare prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: Require packaging to state that a product has been tested on animals
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: Identification of Britains highest decorated fighter Ace Mick Mannock V.C DSO MC
attributes.background: This petition requests investigation, exhumation and identification to prove/disprove the remains of "A British Airman Of The First World War" buried in Laventie Cemetery are in fact those of fighter Ace Edward Mick Mannock. Furthermore, a named reinterment befitting of this hero be conducted.
attributes.additional_details: Mannock was the highest decorated fighter Ace of WWI with a VC, DSO 2 Bars, MC and Bar. It is believed after his death the information passed on by the Germans as to his burial site was incorrect as it laid in "No Mans Land". The body of another airman was found in the area behind German lines with no records provided of the Airman name. It is commonly believed that this Airman, buried and cited as "A British Airman Of The First World War" in Lavenite Cemetery is, in fact, Edward "Mick" Mannock

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in the PM for failure to condemn US stance on refugees.
attributes.background: Theresa May has allied herself to President Trump bringing the UK into disrepute. We want a chance to show our displeasure by asking parliament for a vote of no confidence, triggering a general election

attributes.action: Abolish TV Licencing and Increase National Insurance
attributes.background:
The NHS is funded by N. I. which is proportional to earnings.
The BBC is funded by a Licence Fee which costs a minimum of £145 a year.

People are being forced to pay for a non-essential service while an essential one is in dire need of extra funding. 

We must cut off the BBC to save the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
How much the BBC demand:
https://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/pay-for-your-tv-licence/payment-methods/direct-debit-pay1

How much the NHS needs: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

How much the BBC gets:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/licence_fee.html

attributes.action: Ban plastic staws or introduce a 5p charge for each one.
attributes.background: To help cut down on the amount of single use disposable plastics. As whether they are put in the bin or thrown on the floor the toxic chemicals still leak into our oceans and damage/kill marine life.

attributes.action: Raise the wages for those working in HM Prison Services
attributes.background: The average wage for a Prison officer in the UK is not only low, but is also 10 thousand (in pounds) less than the average paid to prison officers in the USA.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison officers have a very tough and demanding job. Our Prison officers experience every day things most of us would never have to think about or Imagine. Not to mention the hours they serve, and the unsociable times they serve them through. There have been cuts after cuts with the prison service, and its gone on too far. The ratio of HMP staff to number of prisoners is dangerous. Pay our men and woman in the prison service a fair wage for the hard work that they do! Match the USA average.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to breach a contact order issued by the family court.
attributes.background: Far too often non-resident parents spend £1000's in the family court system, to achieve a contact arrangement with their children, only to find the resident parent ignores it and the police are unwilling to take any action.There is rarely any penalty for breaches, and non-contact can go on for years
attributes.additional_details: By making breaching an order a criminal offence with a power of arrest, the police will be able to take action. I believe 99% of the time all that would be needed is for an officer to supervise a handover to the parent with court ordered contact. The power of arrest would enable action when the person with the child refuses to co-operate, also someone could be de-arrested once the child is with the correct parent. A court order is made in the best interests of the child, and should be respected.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into DEFRA's handling of Bird Flu 2016/17
attributes.background: Defra have failed to provide timely, clear & consistent info to poultry keepers and the general public throughout the prevention zone and outbreak period.
attributes.additional_details: The law relating to lockdown requirements is vague.  Defra/Apha/Trading Standards representatives are issuing conflicting information when questions have been raised. The general public have received minimal information via the media, any information has been actively sought by those with online access and a passing knowledge of the situation. We (the public) have many questions that require clear answers.

attributes.action: Where a partner dies before Retirement Age,transfer pension to Partner,for 5yrs
attributes.background: As part of the social care package I would propose that all persons whose life companion, partner, spouse, Husband or Wife died before that reached the stipulated Retirement Age to receive their partners pension, non-means-tested, for a period of Five years after the date of the loved one.
attributes.additional_details: This would also ease the burden on social care and health and be a clear signal of a Steadfast commitment to tackle the crisis of pensioner poverty, social care, and relive the impossible burden upon our NHS

attributes.action: End the ban on the creation of new grammar schools
attributes.background: Planned expansions of existing grammar schools will not be enough to address educational inequality; bright children who live nowhere near to a potential expanded grammar school are being failed.  The ban on the creation of new grammar schools must be repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
Your postcode should not determine your quality of education. Yet the gulf between the worst and best state schools is large and for many, private school is not an option. This has created severe educational inequality, which academic selection will help to address.

Grammar schools should be a top priority in improving opportunities for bright, poorer students. The government should allow the creation of new grammar schools to widen access to a rigorous, traditional and academic education.

attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.

attributes.action: Stop agencies fining those who cannot attend work because of an emergency
attributes.background: Agencies are currently able to issue fines to workers if they do not give 48 hours prior notice that they are unable to attend a shift. If they have an emergency or illness in that 48 hour window they will be fined, whether or not they provide a reason.
attributes.additional_details:
One agency that does this is ROTA, which provides hospitality staff. Given that it is illegal to handle food within 48 hours of diarrhoea or vommiting you could effectively be fined for abiding by the law. 

It is outrageous to fine some of the lowest paid in our society. They already give up a lot of rights by having to take zero hour contracts, and to fine those in the most precarious of employment is deplorable.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: Pressure Myanmar's government to stop the genocide against the Rohingya people
attributes.background: Decades of discrimination and dehumanisation of the Rohingya, an ethnic minority in Myanmar, has ultimately led to genocidal violence from political and religious leaders since 2012, which "may amount to crimes against humanity". The country's leader, a Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, sits idly by.
attributes.additional_details:
Described by the UN as "the world's most persecuted minority", the Rohingya are an ethnic minority who have lived in Myanmar's Arakan state for generations. They were stripped of citizenship in 1982 and are victims of gross human rights violations.

We urge the UK government to pressure the Myanmar government to:
•Allow humanitarian and medical aid into the affected areas
•Allow the UN unrestricted access to conduct their investigations
•Recognise Rohingya as an official ethnic minority

attributes.action: Transfer SouthEastern and Southern services to TfL from 2018 onwards
attributes.background: This petition demands that management and accountability for London's failing Metro services is handed over to TfL and operated under London Overground. Starting with 2018 SouthEastern services to and from Dartford followed by Southern services and others as and when current franchises expire.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Grayling MP has rejected the Mayor of London's proposal to allow TfL to take full control over the failing Southern and SouthEastern franchises when they expire. The London Overground unit has a proven track record of improving punctuality, cleanliness, staffing levels and frequency. Profits are reinvested into the network meaning that services are run for the benefit of passengers. Chris Grayling made a mess of our prisons - we need to stop him doing the same to our transport.

attributes.action: Halt Brexit process & seek legally binding mandate from public post-Trump
attributes.background: The recent change in the US government administration and their subsequent rhetoric and actions have placed the UK in a perilous negotiating position during the Brexit process. Reality of Brexit is also more well defined than pre-referendum meaning public opinion may have changed significantly.
attributes.additional_details: Following the election of Mr. Trump and the subsequent change in US government administration, the US has changed position on numerous issues, with controversy following certain actions too numerous to mention here. We are specifically concerned with where this leaves the UK in our Brexit negotiations given HM Government's timetable for withdrawal, in light of the overwhelming disquiet shown over aligning ourselves with the new US administration against the relative stability of EU membership.

attributes.action: Enforce a minimum of 6 weeks Statutory Paternity Leave to all fathers at 90% pay
attributes.background: Fathers currently take 2 weeks paternity leave when their child is born. Mothers are entitled to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid Statutory). Fathers should spend the first 6 weeks with their babies & partners for support & bonding. Paternity leave should change to minimum 6 weeks at 90% of their salary.

attributes.action: Require the final Brexit deal with the EU to be approved by the UK Parliament
attributes.background:
The formal process of negotiating the exit of the UK from the EU includes 'consent' by MEPs in the European Parliament to the final deal. MPs in the UK Parliament should be afforded the same right as well.
If the UK Parliament fails to consent to the final Brexit deal, the UK should stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The Constitutional Reform and Governance Act 2010 details requirements around International Treaties being put before Parliament, prior to ratification.  The Government has yet to confirm its intention in this regard in respect of the final Brexit deal with the EU. (This is despite repeated requests for clarification by the Select Committee for Exiting the EU).

The UK Parliament is sovereign and its endorsement of the final Brexit deal should be required before ratification and implementation.

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: When the UK leaves the EU British passports should have pink covers.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is all about taking back control and making Britain great again. Let's set our sights high and, remembering the pink all across the globe just 100 years ago, let's have our British passports proudly clad in pink!

attributes.action: LOWER THE AGE OF FREE CHILD CARE FROM 3 TO 2 TO SUPPORT WORKING FAMILIES
attributes.background: In the UK, childcare is provided for working families at the age of 3 which means that from a young age, working families need to pay up to £40 a day for childcare. For full timers this equates to £800 per month. More than the average mortgage payment.
attributes.additional_details: For non working families childcare is provided for free of charge. This is a backwards system as why would someone who doesn't work need their child watched full time. Where as some one who is working has to pay for their child care and receives no support.
